text.__SUMMARY__:
Acacia auripila, commonly known as the Rudall River myall, is a tree of the genus Acacia and the subgenus Plurinerves that is native to a small area in central Western Australia.
The tree typically grows to a height of 3 metres (10 ft) and produces yellow flowers in August.It is native to an area in the eastern Pilbara region of Western Australia where it found on hillsides and gullies.
